page.title: 07INDUSTRY
page.content: {Hall Aggregates Ltd.} { }The Hall Aggregates sand or gravel excavation site was founded IN 1929. Two hectares of farmland are excavated in a year to a depth of 65 metres. The sand or gravel is then removed and sorted into many catagories according to quality etc. After about four years the crater left is filled with building waste (rubble,plastic etc.). After this the crater is filled with 50cms of sand and then 50cms of top soil. it is then leased as farmland. Before Hall Aggregates ever became established on the site this area was used for farmland. One crater has been filled with water and converted into a boating lake.
